New York City is facing significant changes as it delays the All-Electric Buildings Act, while Amazon cuts 700 jobs in NYC as part of a larger 30,000 position reduction; meanwhile, advocates push for a universal daylighting bill and the city unveils rules for a basement apartment legalization pilot program.

### Civics & Politics

- New York agrees to delay All-Electric Buildings Act in court filing.
